page.title: 02AT THE INN,EPPING
page.content: In 1985 Epping,a traditional stopping place for travellers in times gone by, has only one hotel left.{The Post {House Hotel,}which began as a coaching inn in 16oo offers 82 bedrooms costing Â£40 to Â£46 per night.Of the 80 people who work at the hotel only 2% live in Epping.Most come from Harlow.13 staff "live in".Soon local people will have a place to meet,and parties will be catered for. On 17th June 1985 building began on a meeting room for 60 to 80 people. {Travellers}staying at the Post House during the week are{businessmen}who occupy separate rooms and separate tables .At weekends numbers vary; Friday is quieter but on Saturday live entertainment brings more people to stay.Other regular guests include {tourists}from London and airline staff from Stanstead and Heathrow.
